column4: minicom, i need some help getting it to connect, i have already done a setup and nothing ever happens
minicom was no easy to use, when I tried.
make sure your bios is set right, first.  otherwise you'll be wasting time.
what does the bios need to say?
ok, wouldn't the bios cause it not to work in windows?
you're trying to connect to a cisco router, right?
if you've connected in windows, you should know the settings, right?
i do it at school at least twice a week
just a sec, I'm downlaoding minicom to take a look.
Ctrl-A Z, then the settings are in o, should be it.
yes, thats where i'm trying to get it to work
Ctrl-A p for params, the cycle it.  That's as far as I'v gotten.
